channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13053] Add support of Visibility Labels in PerformanceEvaluation
item.description:
Add support of Visibility Labels in PerformanceEvaluation:

During write operations, support adding a visibility expression to KVs.
During read/scan operations, support using visibility authorization.

Here is the usage:

Options:

...

visibilityExp   Writes the visibility expression along with KVs. Use for write commands. Visiblity labels need to pre-exist.

visibilityAuth  Specify the visibility auths (comma separated labels) used in read or scan. Visiblity labels need to pre-exist.
item.summary: Add support of Visibility Labels in PerformanceEvaluation

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

This message is automatically generated.
The test failures are not related since the patch only made changes to PerformanceEvaluation tool.

Rather then add ad-hoc options to PE, can we do this the way we extended LoadTestTool? There we plug in different mutation / KV generators and let the tool specify which one it wants (or we could allow this to be a list), plus generator specific options.

Consider in addition to labels we should have options for ACLs, cell TTLs, or whatever else comes down the line.

Hi, Andrew Purtell

Let me explore that direction. Thanks for the suggestion.
Will report back here.

Looked into LoadTestTool.
The LoadTestTool has been covered pretty well with the data generators, with LoadTestDataGeneratorWithTags, LoadTestDataGeneratorWithVisibilityLabels, etc.
I will try to do the same way in PE.
